aragos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
aragos.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

baccos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
baccos.comment: Sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

bfeos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bfeos.comment: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations
bfeos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water

bsios.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bsios.comment: sum of particulate silica component concentrations
bsios.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water

calcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
calcos.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

chlcalcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chlcalcos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone
chlcalcos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

chldiatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chldiatos.comment: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
chldiatos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

chldiazos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chldiazos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
chldiazos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

chlmiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chlmiscos.comment: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone
chlmiscos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

chlos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chlos.comment: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'
chlos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

chlpicoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
chlpicoos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
chlpicoos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

co3abioos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
co3abioos.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

co3natos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
co3natos.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the natural-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

co3os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
co3os.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

co3sataragos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
co3sataragos.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
co3sataragos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water

co3satcalcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
co3satcalcos.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
co3satcalcos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water

detocos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
detocos.comment: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

dfeos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dfeos.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

dissi13cos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dissi13cos.comment: Near surface dissolved inorganic carbon-13 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

dissi14cabioos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dissi14cabioos.long_name: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration

dissicabioos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dissicabioos.long_name: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration

dissicnatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dissicnatos.comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
dissicnatos.long_name: Surface Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration

dissicos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

dissocos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dissocos.comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

dmsos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dmsos.comment: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water in the near surface layer
dmsos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water

dpco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2.comment: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.

dpco2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2abio.comment: Difference in partial pressure of abiotic-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

dpco2nat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2nat.comment: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

dpo2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpo2.comment: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

eparag100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
eparag100.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Aragonite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for calcite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

epc100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epc100.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
epc100.long_name: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon

epcalc100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epcalc100.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

epfe100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epfe100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

epn100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epn100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

epp100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epp100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

epsi100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
epsi100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

fbddtalk.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtalk.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity
fbddtalk.long_name: Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity

fbddtdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdic.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon
fbddtdic.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity

fbddtdife.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdife.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
fbddtdife.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity

fbddtdin.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdin.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
fbddtdin.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity

fbddtdip.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdip.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of phosphate
fbddtdip.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity

fbddtdisi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdisi.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate
fbddtdisi.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Due to Biological Activity

fddtalk.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtalk.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of alkalinity
fddtalk.long_name: Rate of Change of Total Alkalinity

fddtdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdic.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute.
fddtdic.long_name: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon

fddtdife.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdife.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
fddtdife.long_name: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Iron

fddtdin.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdin.comment: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
fddtdin.long_name: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen

fddtdip.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdip.comment: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate
fddtdip.long_name: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus

fddtdisi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdisi.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate
fddtdisi.long_name: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicon

fg13co2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fg13co2.comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-13 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg13co2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fg14co2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fg14co2.comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg14co2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fg14co2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fg14co2abio.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg14co2abio.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgco2.comment: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)
fgco2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgco2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgco2abio.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)
fgco2abio.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgco2nat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgco2nat.comment: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)
fgco2nat.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgdms.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgdms.comment: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

fgo2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgo2.comment: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)

frfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
frfe.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

fric.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fric.long_name: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

frn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
frn.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.
frn.long_name: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification

froc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
froc.long_name: Downward Organic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

fsfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsfe.comment: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc
fsfe.long_name: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron

fsn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsn.comment: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).
fsn.long_name: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen

icfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
icfriver.comment: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)
icfriver.long_name: Flux of Inorganic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff

intdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intdoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intparag.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbp.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpcalcite.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpn2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpp.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intpp.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
intpp.long_name: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton

intppcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppcalc.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone
intppcalc.long_name: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton

intppdiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppdiat.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone
intppdiat.long_name: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms

intppdiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppdiaz.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophs alone
intppdiaz.long_name: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs

intppmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppmisc.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone
intppmisc.long_name: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton

intppnitrate.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppnitrate.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone
intppnitrate.long_name: Primary Organic Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Based on Nitrate Uptake Alone

intpppico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intpppico.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton component alone
intpppico.long_name: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton

limfecalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfecalc.comment: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfediat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfediaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfemisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfemisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfepico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfepico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limirrcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrcalc.comment: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiat.comment: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiaz.comment: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrmisc.comment: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrpico.comment: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limncalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limncalc.comment: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limndiat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limndiaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limnmisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limnpico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

nh4os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
nh4os.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

no3os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
no3os.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o2min.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
o2min.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

o2os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
o2os.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

o2satos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
o2satos.comment: 'Mole concentration at saturation' means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.
o2satos.long_name: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation

ocfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocfriver.comment: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)
ocfriver.long_name: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff

phabioos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phabioos.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

phnatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phnatos.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

phos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phos.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

phycalcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phycalcos.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone
phycalcos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phycos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phycos.comment: sum of phytoplankton organic carbon component concentrations at the sea surface

phydiatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phydiatos.comment: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
phydiatos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phydiazos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phydiazos.comment: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
phydiazos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phyfeos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phyfeos.comment: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations
phyfeos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water

phymiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phymiscos.comment: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone
phymiscos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phynos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phynos.comment: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations
phynos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Phytoplankton Nitrogen in Sea Water

phypicoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phypicoos.comment: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
phypicoos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phypos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
phypos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water

physios.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
physios.comment: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations
physios.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water

po4os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
po4os.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic phosphorus' means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).
po4os.long_name: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration

ponos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ponos.comment: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations
ponos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water

popos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
popos.comment: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations
popos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water

ppos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ppos.comment: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

sios.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sios.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic silicon' means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).
sios.long_name: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration

spco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.
spco2.long_name: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2

spco2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2abio.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an 'abiotic analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.
spco2abio.long_name: Abiotic Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2

spco2nat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2nat.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a 'natural analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.
spco2nat.long_name: Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2

talknatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
talknatos.comment: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

talkos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
talkos.comment: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

zmesoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zmesoos.comment: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone
zmesoos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmicroos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zmicroos.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone
zmicroos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zmiscos.comment: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.
zmiscos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zo2min.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zo2min.comment: Depth of vertical minimum concentration of dissolved oxygen gas (if two, then the shallower)

zoocos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zoocos.comment: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

zsatarag.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zsatarag.comment: Depth of aragonite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, 'missing' if supersaturated at all depths; if multiple horizons exist, the shallowest should be taken).

zsatcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zsatcalc.comment: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, and missing saturated through whole depth; if two or more horizons exist, then the shallowest is reported)
